column4: im mounting my ext3 partition with options: auto,rw,user,users,exec. what else do i need for it to be rw for a normal user?
your partition should be writable as it stands
it isnt, i tried to copy a directory to it but it says : mv: cannot create directory ... : Permission denied
that isn't the partition's problem. You need to set permissions in the root directory
okies okies, first time im using an ext3 as a files partition so.. ^^' thanks a lot
to be on the safe side, create a subdirectory instead and change the permissions on that
why?.. i want to use the whole partition..
it makes it more difficult to accidently delete the whole file structure!
would it be the same if i change everything in it to a+rw and make the dir itself ro?
that would do the same thing, i think
ok then, ill do that, thanks :)
you can choose to use less inodes if you wish
and why is it using more by default?
ok then, 1.5gb is not so much a loss :P
